Half-Life 2 does literally nothing to hook the player in. 

It is extremely lacking in things for the player to both see and do with very little NPCs to build some sort of bond with. The weaponry is very bland with many of the weapons serving an identical purpose to others except one option is better than the other, essentially cutting your arsenal in half compared to previously in HL1 where most of your entire arsenal was completely unique to each other and all weapons served a different purpose that allows the player to solve all sorts of different problems uniquely in their own way. 

The player is left with very little weapons to work with, factoring in the fact that your arsenal is essentially cut in half. There are no stores, there are no upgrades to either yourself or your weapons (unless you count the better versions to be an "upgrade", which is lame), this is all you will have for the rest of the game. You don't get any sort of special ability like the long jump in HL1 to expand upon your movement potential, the player is limited to glitching out the physics engine instead which most players do not know how to do or do not want to do. 

Half-Life 2's enemies are also crazy difficult. I only played the game on Normal, and I had never in my life played a more difficult game. I beat Doom 2016 on Nightmare and I've at least played Doom Eternal on Nightmare numerous times as well as beating the entire Dead Space trilogy on their hardest difficulties among many other games, and nothing manages to take the cake as being so difficult quite like f*cking HL2 on Normal difficulty. 

I get it, the enemies are NPCs, they need aimbot to shoot the player. But their aimbot is so, well, aimbotty that it's comparable to hackers in multiplayer FPS games. Their aim is entirely unfair. Speaking of the enemies, the combine are incredibly bland with limited dialogue to listen to on top of all of them just being the same guy. Their AI is advanced but they're not enjoyable to fight against.

The game doesn't give out enough health and ammo. It saved twice on me when I had 1 HP left and no health in sight, the 2nd time I literally didn't have ammo and was left with nothing but my crowbar and bug bait so I had only ant lions to rely on to kill the combine. 

Due to the game lacking any sort of map system, it is extremely easy to get lost in the game. I have gotten lost numerous times really having no f*cking idea where to go. I literally got lost in a map for 70 minutes. 60 of those minutes were of me legitimately trying to figure out where to go, while the remaining 10 minutes I activated cheats and started no-clipping around the map and still struggled to understand where to drop myself off and continue from. 

Certain enemies in the game are complete bullet sponges and take like 6 rockets to kill which was extremely un-fun considering the fact that these enemies were used numerous times throughout the game, making it tedious and unsatisfying to just sit there forever shooting rockets at them while sitting on top of an ammo box forever replenishing your rockets. It doesn't help that they were semi-mobile and dodged your rockets. I swear during one of them the box also ran out of rockets forcing me to reload a save. 

The story of the game is also very non-applicable in terms of a video game. It's more applicable to a book. It is insanely boring and un-enjoyable to play when you just kinda have to sit around while NPCs talk to you, or have to explore vast nothings with a few combine and boring NPCs around while rarely any music ever ends up playing in the places you get lost in. 

Nothing in this game ends up actually being fun and enjoyable outside of speedrunning tactics and abusing the physics engine. I highly do not recommend this game at all to anyone.
